restriction_instructions.data_distribution: To be made available to all S1000D users.

export_control.export_registration_stmt: Export of this data module to all countries that are the residence of organizations that are users of S1000D is permitted. Storage of this data module is to be at the discretion of the organization.

restriction_instructions.data_handling: There are no specific handling instructions for this data module.
restriction_instructions.data_destruction: Users may destroy this data module in accordance with their own local procedures.
restriction_instructions.data_disclosure: There are no dissemination limitations that apply to this data module.

learning_content.title: Front Wheel Removal
learning_content.description: The content of this data model describes the steps for removing the bicycle front wheel.

levelled_para.text: To remove your bike's front wheel, place the bike on a stand. If you do not have a stand, you can still remove the tire. It will just take a little coordination on your part.
Begin by either deflating the front tire slightly or disconnecting the front brakes. This is done so the wheel can come out easily and not get stuck at the brake pads.
If your bike has a quick release lever, you can simply pull the lever and remove the wheel from the fork.
If your bike has nuts, you will need to loosen them with a wrench before removing the wheel.
Once the wheel is removed, you can inspect the tire, tube, and rim for any damage.
If the tire is flat, you can replace the tube or patch it.
